om.stdquestion
Class StandardQuestion

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.StandardQuestion
All Implemented Interfaces:
Question
Direct Known Subclasses:
NullQuestion, SimpleQuestion1
public abstract class StandardQuestion
extends java.lang.Object
implements Question

Standard Om question with question components defined in initial XML.

public void callback(java.lang.String sCallback)
              throws OmException
Calls a particular callback function. The function must previously have been checked using checkCallback().

Parameters:

Throws:
OmException - If the callback throws an exception or there was an error calling it

checkCallback

public void checkCallback(java.lang.String sCallback)
                   throws OmDeveloperException
Checks that a callback method is present and correctly defined.

Having checked it, you can call it using callback().

Parameters:
sCallback - Name of callback method
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If the method doesn't exist or is defined incorrectly

end

protected void end()
            throws OmDeveloperException
Causes the question to end. (Call from within action processing; you can't end a question in the init() call.) Control returns from this method as usual, although you probably shouldn't do anything else afterwards.

Throws:
OmDeveloperException

getResults

protected Results getResults()
Returns a Results object, which you can use to set up the results or summary of the question. Changing things in the Results object does not actually cause results to be sent to the test navigator. You should call sendResults() once they are final.

Returns:
A Results object for you to modify.

sendResults

protected void sendResults()
                    throws OmDeveloperException
Causes the information in the Results object to be sent to the test navigator and stored. You should call this only once per question; it doesn't have to be right at the end of the question (although it can be).

Throws:
OmDeveloperException

setProgressInfo

protected void setProgressInfo(java.lang.String sProgressInfo)
                        throws OmDeveloperException
Sets the progress information text, which is displayed outside the question to give the user an idea of their progress through this question (e.g. 'You have 3 attempts left'.)

If you don't call this, the progress info remains the same as it was before (blank, if you never set it).

Parameters:
sProgressInfo - Progress string
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

eatLog

public java.lang.String eatLog()
Returns:
the debug display log, and clear it.

log

public void log(java.lang.String s)
Logs a string to the debug display log (used only in development servlet).

Parameters:
s - String to log

setPlaceholder

protected void setPlaceholder(java.lang.String sPlaceholder,
                              java.lang.String sValue)
Sets the value of a placeholder.

Placeholders are anything that ends up in the XHTML output with __ either side e.g. __A__. When you set the value of a placeholder, it is replaced everywhere it occurs with the given value. Values stay set so you don't need to re-set them every time there is an action call.

Placeholders work in attributes as well as in text. They do not work in tag names.

Placeholder values are set in the DOM not in the final XHTML string, so there is no need to escape special characters with ampersands or similar.

Parameters:
sPlaceholder - Name of placeholder (part between __ signs, e.g. "A")
sValue - Value to replace placeholder with (e.g. "3.14")

applyPlaceholders

public java.lang.String applyPlaceholders(java.lang.String sValue)
Applys placeholders to a string. Mostly useful for components that need to handle strings in some other way than simply outputting XHTML (e.g. include string in a graphc).

Parameters:
sValue - Original string
Returns:
String with any placeholders applied

getRandom

public java.util.Random getRandom()
Obtains a random number generator for the question, based on the random seed specifed by the test navigator but modified uniquely for this class (so that if two questions in the test need a random number between 1 and 5, they will have a chance of getting different ones).

Returns:
Random number generator

getRandom

public java.util.Random getRandom(java.lang.String sGroup)
Obtains a random number generator based on the seed specified by the test navigator but modified uniquely for this group. Use this variant when several questions need the same sequence of random numbers (for example they are about properties of an element and you want it to be the same element). As long as you use the same group name for the questions, they will receive an identical generator [when used by the same user].

Parameters:
sGroup - Group name (arbitrary string)
Returns:
Random number generator
